sentence: homeowners in close proximity to foreclosures experience even greater losses in value than the general price declines that occur as a market absorbs a large number of distressed sales.
this "shadow inventory" threatens to continue the downward pressure on housing prices and further destabilizes communities.
what began as a problem rooted in poorly underwritten loans has been exacerbated by high unemployment and slow economic growth.

indicators include such things as median sales prices, number of sales as a percent of housing units, foreclosure filings as a percentage of sales, percentage of commercial properties, percentage of tax abated properties or newly constructed properties, percentage of owner-occupied properties, and residential vacancy rates.
including rental options among the mix of stabilization strategies makes particular sense at a time of high unemployment.
